content:
I have two List.maps on either side of an equality, I would like to show these are equal. I'm thinking the right way to do this is by induction, or cases. (I'm honestly not entirely clear what the practical difference is).

So I try induction (List.map foo bar), but it says the major premise isn't an inductive type. The same messages for cases.
Hmm, okay I think I 'fixed' it, something wrong with my indentation was all. Dunno what was up.
Alex Meiburg has marked this topic as resolved.

You might find List.map_congr, useful
@loogle |- List.map _ ?l = List.map _ ?l
if your lists are the same and the functions differ
I found that, but it's the same function and the lists differ :)
but I've been trying to rewrite it into a nicer form where hopefully I _can_ use that
